text: Frederick Rudolph Dean (February 24, 1952 - October 14, 2020) was an American former professional football player. He was a defensive end in the National Football League (NFL). He was a member of the Pro Football Hall of Fame. His career started with the San Diego Chargers in 1975 and ended with the San Francisco 49ers after the 1985 season. A two-time first-team All-Pro and a four-time Pro Bowler, he won two Super Bowls with the 49ers. On October 8, 2020, Dean was diagnosed with COVID-19 and hospitalized in West Monroe, Louisiana. He died a few days later on October 14 while being airlifted from West Monroe to Jackson, Mississippi at the age of 68.Reports: Hall of Fame defensive end Fred Dean dies of COVID-19 at 68 ==References== Category:1952 births Category:American football defensive ends Category:American football linebackers Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:San Diego Chargers players Category:San Francisco 49ers players Category:Sportspeople from Louisiana
title: Fred Dean
